Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: ellis72
Reviews.Content: we've been there for 4 days and it was fantastic stay, perfect location near the central station which is connected to all the public transportation. the owner & the staff is very friendly and helpfull. they give us all the informations that we need about the city.the room is new and big. the wifi is free all day. i will definitely stay there again and recommend it to all my friends and travellers!

Reviews.Title: “Good, cheap, convenient, no frills and clean hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Epinephrine
Reviews.Content: It is a 2 star by Rome city guide but it is a family run hotel. Situated on the 3rd floor and not accessible if you are on a wheel chair or if your baby pram is a huge one. The owners of the hotel are friendly but not warm. They are there to provide a service and not to be your friends. We booked 2 rooms with one 16 month old kid. The room is clean, tidy and comfortable. Do not expect room service because it is not a full service hotel. The rooms are air-conditioned, has a fridge for your own drinks and a safe for your valuables. Clean towels are provided once during the entire stay. The rooms are cleaned daily by a cleaner. It is situated next to Stazione Termini Roma. Getting there to any point in Rome is extremely convenient. Breakfast is served in a cafe down the street. One piece of pastry with coffee or juice. Any other side orders you pay. I would come back to this hotel again because it is just cheap, clean and good.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Magical about his Hotel. STAY AWAY!”
Reviews.Author: pars3221
Reviews.Content: We were leaving for Naples and needed to stay in a hotel near the Termini Station and figured this would be an ok hotel. I would start with the positive note (which is only one!) The room was clean. That’s it. Now the negatives. The location is great, near the Termini but the neighborhood felt a little dangerous, especially at night. There were homeless people passed out everywhere around the area. The hotel is on a 4th floor of a building which houses several hotels. Owner is an old lady and her daughter is the manager, the problem is they don’t speak any English and when we tried to communicate, it was like pulling teeth, they would shout at you.. Very grumpy! The breakfast was a voucher at a near place bar for a cappuccino and a dry pastry! Nothing special. When you checked in they would give you a set of keys, one for the main door downstairs, one for the interior door and one for your room, however if you came back late, they added a third gate which you did had keys for, so we hand to end up calling the owner and waking them so they could let us in.. not fun.. When we checked out, I was going to pay with my credit card (as stated in the booking.com website) and they tried to play the game of the credit card machine not working and stuff, when I told them I did not have cash, magically the credit card machine started to work. Also something in the bathroom pipes, which made the room smell like a death wish! STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: RezaSaadat
Reviews.Content: I never recommend this hotel.Although the room is clean and hotel is near Rome Termini , but it is a very small hotel on the fourth floor of a building in which each floor is a small hotel!!! The owner is an old woman and her doughters .All are very rude. All the rooms is around a small reception desk. All day and night they are speaking loudly to guests who are checking in and out. Sometime they shout ! So Rooms are very noisy you you will wake up many times at night. Towels are Torn. No refregerator(althogh it was in Booking.com magic hotel facility).very small lift .Very small bathroom.No shampoo.no breakfast facility. The owners usually are not at her desk(it seems only to come to shout!) and if you want something, you have to go at her house door on the other part of hotel that was not comfortable for me.The nearby street with its peaple is not good at all. Aftre all ,this hotel will give you a very bad feeling as a hotel. Take another one. Even if you have to pay alittle more.If not, It will be your worst experience in Rome

Reviews.Title: “It was indeed magic”
Reviews.Author: YvonneDiana
Reviews.Content: I choosed this hotel because it was located near Termini. I could actually see it when I got of the bus from the airport. It was very neat with polished marble floors and clean rooms. The view from the room was cozy and overall it was a friendly and nice hotel with good prices. The only reasons that it's not getting full points are the following: - I asked for a room where smoking was allowed. I didn't get it. - They speaked very poor english. I was glad I had an italian friend who could help me out. - No food at all. You did get breakfast tickets to a nearby place though.

Reviews.Title: “great rooms, great location, great owners”
Reviews.Author: katsglaze
Reviews.Content: This hotel, Hotel Magic, is awesome. Carmella and her two daughters run this hotel and there is nothing they wont do for you. Sure, Carmella doesnt speak much english, nor do I speak much Italian, but the 8 nights there were nothing but great. The location if perfect for the main rail station and metro's. The rooms are clean and comfy (beds are european hard, but if you need a softer pillow, just ask). Yes, the elevator is small, but heck, at least there is one and my friend June and I laughed about it. Upon arrival you may have to go up one person and one suitcase at a time, but it is quick. Only a couple times did the people going to the 4th floor forget to close the red doors, so the elevator works...there is a huge sign in english and italian on the door, dumb people. But even if you have to walk up to the 3rd floor it is do-able. They give you 3 keys...one to the outside door on the street, one to the inside door before reception and one to your room. Heck, if you dont feel safe with this arrangement you are crazy. There are fabulous little places to eat all around and we made friends and were remembered each time we walked by them. The breakfast at Cafe Amici, is good and they are super nice there also (always remembered our daily drink and croissant). The price was remarkable for Rome, $75 a night for two beds with private clean bath, with bidet, toilet, shower and heated towel racks. What else could you ask for??? Not much!!!! I recomment this hotel highly and would use it again and again and again...Thanks Mama Carmella!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but very rude owners”
Reviews.Author: IvetAngelova
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed there for two nights in 2006. Since I was already in Rome I checked in first (and by checking in I mean the old lady owner taking my passport and returning it only after I asked for it). She said it was OK if my boy checked in the next day, since he was arriving in Rome late that night (and obviously they didn't have 24h reception). That was the reason for the younger owner, the daughter I guess, to shout at us and to tell us off in a very rude and aggressive manner the next morning. It didn't matter that we had already agreed on that with her mother. On top of that the day we left we asked if we could leave our luggage there for a few hours (the page we booked the hotel through stated they DO HAVE a left luggage office). And what a surprise, they didn't let us! Despite all that, the room was nice and clean. But it's not enough to make you get over the first bad impression. They should learn to treat their clients better first and also try to be more professional in running the so called hotel. Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The worst experience EVER”
Reviews.Author: Viajandoporai
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel at Internet. Nice website, nice pictures. When I got there... oh my God! I asked for a room with a view and they gave me one, with a view to internal area (thousand windows only!), the owners (a woman and her mother) are sooooo agressive! The mother doesn´t speak english, only italian and, as I could notice, doesn´t write or read. As her daughter wasn´t there, she wanted to keep my passport until the day after. I said no and she started shouting, saying I was stupid, that she wouldn´t eat my passport with pasta, bla bla bla. I can´t describe how she treated me. On the day after, the owner, her daughter, came and talked soooo agressive way to me...NEVER STAY THERE, unless you like to be in the middle of a horror movie.

Reviews.Title: “very strange setup!”
Reviews.Author: hj84
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my sister in April 2005, arrived the night before the Pope died so maybe it explains a little why the service was strange! The hotel's not in the nicest area but it is very convenient for the train snd bus station. we were confused at first by the apartment block setup - the owners live across the corridor from the hotel. we were concerned as the owner lady took our passports from us, saying she had to fill in a form - then didn't bring them back! we had to get them back from another one of the family later - no harm done but it didn't seem the most organised operation. the breakfasts were equally disorganised - we were given a voucher for a cafe around the corner, but it was only valid for one out of the 3 nights we were staying, so we didn't get breakfast after the first day. The room itself we found to be fine, not the lap of luxury but then that's not what we expected. the only other thing we had a problem with was when we came back a bit late (around 11:30pm) and the outer door to the hotel part was locked. when we were given our keys we were told we'd have to unlock the inner glass door, which we had a key for, but someone had shut the huge wooden one - meaning we had to get the older owner lady out of bed to come and let us in. we weren't informed of any curfew if there was one. all in all - it wasn't a disaster but i wouldn't go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Totally awful”
Reviews.Author: mcngdr
Reviews.Content: The WORST hotel we ever stayed! The owners are extremely rude and loud, they are not courteous at all. Our first impression of the area was very negative once we saw many people coming out from Termini station. The surrounding was dirty. We can smell fish fry from the hotel...constantly. Bathroom is extremely smelly like sewer smell. We tried to get out early, and owners started yelling. It was horrible, disrespectful, and plain rude.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: tigerchu
Reviews.Content: We (4 travellers) booked Hotel Magic because we checked its website and it looks so beautiful. It is totally misleading. We got there, and yes it is around the Termini station. Very little did we know that the area near station is not very safe. According to some local shop owners, any areas in Rome is pretty safe from any violence crime...but beware of pickpockets. Termini area has so many people coming from all over the place, and so packed, so again, beware of pickpockets! Local shop owners said, get out of there, don't walk at night...bla bla bla. So, we were so bothered by this and we decided to move to another hotel the next day. The next morning, the lady who owns the hotel was so mad at us that she refused to charge only the night we stayed...she wanted to charge us for 3 nights! We were arguing with her and she was extremely rude. She yelled at us, threw our reservation paper right in front of our face while raising her voice and her hands. It was the most terrible and rude thing we ever experienced. So, we ended up paying for 2 nights, although we only stayed for 1 night. Another thing, although the room is nice, the bathroom is outside the room, and it smelled so bad. The shower has rust all over it, the bathroom floor was very slimy. We ended up moving to an old hotel, in a nicer neighborhood around Park Borghese. That morning full of arguing and yelling from the hotel owner put us in a very bad mood all day. Don't stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Very Deceptive Website”
Reviews.Author: macartist26
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure where these pictures came from, but it couldn't have been Hotel Magic. First impression was negative--had to walk through areas where we didn't feel safe, seeing garbage stuffed into window grilles along the sidewalk. It was near the train station, which could be both good and bad. Good because you can walk from the train--bad because it's generally not the nicest part of town. This place was on the third floor (our fourth) with a very narrow, spiral staircase leading to it. Very tough to maneuver bags up and down (and I'm not a large person). The lift did not work. Staff wasn't particularly friendly and spoke VERY limited English. The room was not clean. I have used better towels to wash my car. The plastic cups in the bathroom had dried toothpaste on them. According to the website, we expected "a very good breakfast at their breakfast bar" -- not the case. You had to track someone down and get a handwritten slip and then walk about three blocks to a diner where you received one croissant and a small coffee. If you wanted anything above that, you had to pay more. We were also informed that we had to pay our final bill in cash--they didn't accept credit cards, very different from what the website states. If I could do it over again, I definitely would have stayed somewhere else. Buyer, beware.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel”
Reviews.Author: katie1247
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the worst that I ever stayed at. The owner was rude and gave people a curfew of when they had to be back in the hotel. The private bathroom she adversites is actually down the hall and other people use it. She was not helpful in any matter and we ended up leaving a day early because of the service and the rooms. The beutiful rooms they have on the website are not anything that they actully have. I would never recommed this hotel to anyone that I know.

Reviews.Title: “Plain hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The "Hotel" is located close to the train station, grocery shop, Laundromat/internet access, cheaper restaurants. The "Hotel" is on the 3rd floor and there are 2 other hotels in the same building, 1st and 2nd floor. The lift can accommodate 3 people without luggage or 2 with 1 luggage + 1 hand carry. The "Hotel" is more like a old apartment rather than a hotel (haven’t stayed in a 1 or 2 star hotel before, so maybe that is what it should look like). The centre of the building it has a square shape hole. There is a restaurant at the bottom. At night you can smell the cooking and cooking noise if you leave the windows open. Luckily in the month on June is quite cool the window was closed. Their web site is nicely created but the actual differs to it. The bathroom/toilet looks like an old apartment bathroom. They won’t accept credit card. No wake up call. Breakfast is located in a shop on the next block serving only 1 drink and 1 bread roll eg. croissant. I am not sure where they get their pictures of the bathrooms maybe we got the worse old type bathroom which has some mold and rusty hanger. The extra bed sags in the middle. Not sure if they charge extra for aircond as the remote was removed. Was very disappointed with the web site advertisement and the actual experience. The owner lives in an apartment on the same floor. On the day we had to check out the lift was not working so I have to carry all our bags down the windy steps :(

Reviews.Title: “Good economy class hotel in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We took a 2 week vacation this summer to Venice, Florence, with our final destination in Rome. Since we were traveling by train it was convienent to have our hotels located near the train stations. We chose Hotel Magic as our Rome hotel based on a recommendation from Rick Steve's Italy Travel Guide. We found the accomendations very shabby as compared to other hotels we stayed in. However, the beds were adequate and the rooms were clean. The hotel is located a block from the train station and the two main metro lines making all of Rome easily accesable. There was a lot of street noise late into the night and air conditioning was not turned on in June. The staff was not very friendly initially and their English skills were minimal. However, they improved on discovering that we were paying cash. Also, the rooms are located on the fifth floor and the elevator was not functioning. Unless you're on a tight budget and traveling by train, I would try a different hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Magic
HotelInfo.Address: Via Milazzo, 20, 00185 Rome, Italy
